articles.title: Divers make a surprise Titanic discovery
articles.description: The Titanic wreck is slowly degrading about 4,000 meters below the surface of the North Atlantic Ocean. A 26-year-old sonar blip revealed
articles.content:
The Titanic wreck is slowly degrading about 4,000 meters below the surface of the North Atlantic Ocean.
A 26-year-old sonar blip revealed this underwater area’s vastness.
Nautile submersible pilot and Titanic diver Pierre Nargeolet discovered the bli... [2840 chars]

articles.title: Birkenhead baker survived Titanic sinking by drinking whisky
articles.description: Charles Joughin was the last survivor to leave the Titanic
articles.content:
A baker from Birkenhead survived hours in freezing waters after the sinking of the Titanic.
Charles Joughin, born in 1878, was a chef from Birkenhead who worked as a chief baker on the historic RMS Titanic boat. The RMS Titanic was a British passenge... [3405 chars]

articles.title: An immersive staycation at the Titanic Hotel and Museum
articles.description: Housed in the former Harland & Wolff headquarters, a looming red brick building that appears deceptively compact, the Titanic Hotel is a masterclass in bringing history into the present.
articles.content: It can be easy to forget that we live on the same island that once produced the largest moving object ever made by man, that generations of Harland & Wolff workers forged Belfast's reputation as the engineering capital of the world, and that its most... [5872 chars]

articles.title: Titanic Belfast exhibition centre announces temporary closure in 2023 to facilitate refresh
articles.description: The popular Titanic Belfast exhibition is to close for over a month and-a-half in the new year as the tourist spot undergoes a multi-million-pound refresh.
articles.content: Titanic Belfast’s Head of Operations, Denise Kennedy, is joined by Visitor Experience Crew Carol McMullan and Philip Moffett as the world-leading visitor attraction announces that work will begin on a multi-million pound refreshment programme in Janu... [2114 chars]

articles.title: Even Avatar 2’s trailers are uniquely built for the big screen
articles.description: Avatar: The Way of Water’s new trailer doesn’t worry about plot or characters, and instead sells majestic images that need to be seen in 3D HDR. In two minutes, the Titanic and Terminator 2 director makes the case for going to movie theaters.
articles.content: “Return to Pandora.” This, in all its simplicity, is the sell for James Cameron’s Avatar: The Way of Water. The latest trailer does not tease “the saga continues.” There’s no mention of “the Na’vi are back.” There’s just a simple appeal: Remember tha... [4055 chars]
